intro: Pseudotephrocactus, commonly known as the rock cactus, is a genus of cacti native to Mexico. These plants are characterized by their cylindrical stems and are often covered in spines or bristles. They typically grow in rocky or arid environments, adapting to extreme desert conditions. Pseudotephrocactus species are usually low-growing and have a compact appearance. Their flowers, when present, are often yellow or orange and bloom during the warmer months.
